reviews.review_msg: One of the most organized profs I had. Kate was clear in lectures and expectations. Class was flawless in execution. Allowed people to come in person or to attend class online which was nice. Beware MCQ quizzes. Assignments were helpful and not too taxing.

Kate is one of the most accomodating and kind professors I have met at SFU. The lectures were engaging as she brought many guest speakers and the quizzes were very straightforward. The final presentation was fun to work on and I would recommend taking HSCI 431 if you're interested in learning more about HIV/AIDS.
Inspiring

She may have a problem of speech, and she has to use "um" in every sentence. I do not know whats the point of letting so many guests to hold the lectures. What I know is she needs to practice speaking more clearly.

Dr. Miller did a great job teaching hsci 431. First of all, the material is actually really interesting since you're learning about one topic in particular. Secondly, Cari is super nice, approachable, organized, knowledgeable, etc. I loved this course and would recommend it to other students in a heartbeat!
The lectures are basically pointless because everything is based on the readings. She has a problem with speaking clearly.
Wonderful course!  Enjoyed taking it.

How did is this woman allowed to teach? She hardly ever taught only had guest speakers, made it hard to get a good mark and can't complete a single sentence without using the word "um." When she didn't feel like teaching she got her husband to come teach the class, and this class is suppose to be her speciality. If you don't want to teach, quit!

Dr. Duff provided invaluable advice and guidance in developing a research manuscript for my sexual health medical research practicum. Her door was always open, scheduled frequent check-ins and she provided detailed feedback that improved my writing and ability to critically appraise research. I cannot recommend her highly enough.

Dr. Duff's class changed the way I think about people living with HIV. Her classes were engaging and challenging with activities every week. Dr. Duff is passionate about the topic and it shows in her classes and the detailed feedback. She does mark to a high standard, so you need to put in the work.

Dr Duff is very friendly and approachable for questions. Her lectures can be a bit dull but she is very capable of teaching the material. Exams are fair and the material covered is directly from her study guide. Expectations on the assignments/paper can be a little unclear/confusing so definitely ask for further clarification.

Putu is really nice, she's new to teaching and tried her best to teach us the material but the class itself was marked very harshly for a 4th year seminar. Questions on midterm was straightforward but marked in a way that made it very hard to get high marks. She couldn't convey what her and the TA's were looking for in paper and group assignments.
I am still disgusted by her calling me lazy despite her onowledge of the death in my family less than 2 weeks ago.

Never for once had people called me lazy (let alone after my dear one's death) until I met her. I was surprised to read the positive comments. I regretted dealing with her but the horrible experience serves as a constant reminder that it's all over now and i should be grateful for it.

Anglea is an amazing professor! Her classes aren't easy by any means but I honestly think I learned the most in her class over any other class in my entire undergrad! She is a great lecturer, understanding, gives clear and helpful instructions and overall provides a really positive learning experience. Definitely take a course with her if you can!

Angela's notes are clear and to the point. She doesn't give out a lot of readings, but expects the ones she gives out to be done. The class was fairly marked and the assignments were all original and informative. She really wants students to learn and be engaged with the material of the class. Best prof I have had at SFU!
She is not a bad professor, however, super boring plus extremely hard exams.  Just don't waste your time on it. NOT RECOMMENDED!

I really enjoyed Cathy's class. The classes were really interesting and kept your attention. I feel like I learned a lot. The online discussions were cool and the in class quiz cards helped review. The guest speakers were great too! I would definitely take this class again.

Cathy is one of my favourite professors at SFU. She has been my TA and professor and she is honestly the most helpful, caring and nicest person! She is always available for extra help and replies back to emails with detailed feedback. I would highly recommend taking a course with her and hope she teaches more upper division courses! :)
Super sweet guy. Class consisted of 2 quizzes/midterms, weekly short presentations, reflections, and a final art project. Dr. Hogg was always very caring and kind. Chill class too.

He is very knowledgeable and respectful. Lectures are not too long, over an hour of each class goes to small group discussions. Easy short weekly presentation slides before each class based on the reading material. Midterm was hard with some confusing questions, the final project is very creative and relatively easy to get good marks.

Midterm was insanely stupid. Worth 40%, refused to give us any heads up on what would be on it, then is shocked when the average was 45%. He really does not care about teaching the class at all. None of his assignments have any criteria and even the TAs aren't sure how to help us.

Dr Hogg is a world-renowned HIV expert. Yes he brings in guest speakers, but that means students are exposed to not just one, but MANY experts in the field. This rarely happens in undergrad courses. He's in high demand to speak all around the world so its pretty amazing to have him as your prof, no matter how many times he lectures.

As expert as it gets when it comes to HIV. He's funny and great at teaching, but I was surprised as to how many guest lecturers there were in an HIV class when Dr. Hogg is an HIV expert. Overall, the class is informative but you really have to know your stuff to ace the exams.

so his supposed expertise is HIV and this is an HIV class and i didn't learn anything whatsoever. he did not lecture half the time. one time attendance was worth 10%. no clear course outline and provided rubric for a paper 2 days before its due. its a miracle i got an A.

It was my first time taking a course with Dr. Small and I can see why others have taken multiple courses with him. His lectures were interesting, relevant, and enjoyable as he was genuinely passionate about the content and incorporated interesting in-class activities to complement the learning materials. I learned so much from this class!

Dr.Grace is very helpful and he is very good at explaining things to the class. He tries his best best to be clear as possible. Although the attendance is not mandatory it is for the students benefit to attend class. Overall good professor and an reasonable course!
